summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors between 1994 and 1997, and with perjury for false statements made in a 2016 deposition. The document outlines the allegations of grooming and abuse and announces the case assignment.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and with perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier with whom Maxwell allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls. Described as having a preference for young girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Made the public announcement of the charges against Maxwell and provided a statement on the allegations.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI
persons.context: Provided a statement commending the victims' bravery and outlining the FBI's role in the investigation.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Provided a statement condemning the alleged crimes and commending investigators.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to sexually abuse minor girls, with Maxwell facilitating, grooming, and participating in the abuse.
Alleged to have befriended, groomed, and delivered minor girls to be sexually abused by Epstein and, in some cases, by herself.
Alleged to have sexually abused minor girls, with the abuse facilitated by Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a federal indictment unsealed in Manhattan.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The timeframe during which Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell allegedly made several false statements under oath during a civil proceeding deposition.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and indicted on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors and on perjury charges.
The alleged conspiracy involved grooming and abusing girls as young as 14 years old between 1994 and 1997.
Maxwell is accused of playing a critical role by befriending victims, normalizing sexual behavior, and being present for abuse at locations in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.
Maxwell was additionally charged with perjury for false statements made during a 2016 deposition related to the abuse allegations.
The case was assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
